snippet: A conflict between Ronald O. Perelman, stepping down as chairman, and Clive Gillinson, Carnegie’s executive and artistic director, has the institution confronting an unusual public crisis.
abstract: Carnegie Hall prepares to open 125th season under shadow of unusually public conflict involving recently-resigned board president Ronald O Perelman, recently-reinstated executive and artistic director Clive Gillinson and possible conflict of interest regarding Warner Music Prize.
lead_paragraph: A conflict between Ronald O. Perelman, stepping down as chairman, and Clive Gillinson, Carnegie’s executive and artistic director, has the institution confronting an unusual public crisis.

headline.print_headline: Carnegie Faces Strife as It Enters New Season
headline.main: Carnegie Hall Faces Internal Strife Ahead of Anniversary Season
